text:
When running vssget against a remote vssdatabase on a server on the same 
intranet, I run a ant target which includes the following attributes:

 <vssget localpath="${jsrc}"
              recursive="true"
              vsspath="${SSProjectPath}/${jsrc}"
              ssdir="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\VSS\win32"
              writable="false"/>

The command just "hangs" when I run it via command line.

I have run this target with -v and -debug flags to no avail.

I have also been able to see that there is a SS.EXE running after I initiate 
the target to do the vss get so I know it is invoking SourceSafe (i.e. finding 
the vss exe file).

I have run out of options on this problem and am turning to the bug database 
now.

antoine@apache.org
text:
Try to add a login attribute to your vssget task.
See http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/vss.html#vssget
From the documentation : 
login
username[,password] - The username and password needed to get access to VSS. 
Note that you may need to specify both (if you have a password) - Ant/VSS will 
hang if you leave the password out and VSS does not accept login without a 
password.

I'm having a similar problem using vssget.  My target is as follows:

<vssget localPath="C:\Java\vss\src\ui"
	recursive="true"
	login="joesomebody,passwordhere"
	vsspath="$/VSS/Java/Source/ui"
        writable="true"/>

The command seems to work fine in a VSS project (on a remote server) where there
is a small # of files, i.e. 5,7,9 have all worked ok.  However vssget seems to
hang in projects where there are more than 50 files or so (estimated) since it
has failed on 77 & 106.  SS.EXE & java.exe is running in the Task Manager, and
doesn't go away until you kill the batch process in the command window.

My environment is as follows:

Windows 2000 SP3
JDK 1.2.2
Ant 1.6.1
Microsoft Visual Sourcesafe 6.0
